\py[20]\>\dac\{\c[2]By the sweat of your brow you will eat
\dac your food until you return to the ground,
\dac since from it you were taken;
\dac for dust you are and to dust you will return.
\>\dac\{\c[2]I have seen all the things that are done under the sun;
\dac all of them are meaningless, a chasing after the wind.
\>\dac\{\c[2]And we know that all things work together for
\dac good for those who love God,
\dac who are called according to His purpose.
\dac short of the glory of God.
\py[20]\>\dac\{\c[2]For the vision is yet for an appointed time;
\dac it speaks of the end and will not prove false.
\dac Though it lingers, wait for it;
\dac it will certainly come and will not delay.
\dac like a burden too heavy to bear.

\dac He replied, "My name is Legion, for we are many."
\dac a great red dragon with seven heads and ten horns,
\dac and on its heads were seven crowns. Its tail swept
\dac a third of the stars from the sky and cast them to the earth
\>\dac\{\c[2]\py[30]O shining one, son of the morning!
\dac How have you fallen from heaven?
\dac You who once laid nations low,
\dac how have you been cast down to the earth?
\>\dac\{\c[2]\py[20]And I saw a beast rising out of the sea.
\dac It had ten horns and seven heads,
\dac with ten crowns on its horns,
\dac and blasphemous names on its heads.
\dac\{\c[2]Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
\dac I will fear no evil, for You are with me;
\dac Your rod and Your staff, they comfort me.
\>\dac\{\c[2]The Lord said to Satan, "Where have you come from?"
\dac Satan answered, "From roaming the earth, going back and forth upon it."
